security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill with no executable code. It contains only markdown files that define task management conventions and examples. No security risks detected.

content.user_title: Organize Project Tasks with Plans.md Management
content.value_statement: Keep your project tasks organized and track progress systematically. This skill helps you manage task lifecycles in Plans.md files with consistent formatting and status tracking.
actual_capabilities: Adds new tasks to Plans.md with proper formatting
Updates task status markers (cc:TODO, cc:WIP, cc:ÂÆå‰∫Ü)
Maintains consistent Plans.md structure with sections
Supports Japanese and English task descriptions
limitations: Only works with Plans.md files in the root directory
Requires specific marker format with backticks
Limited to task management operations only

use_cases.title: Track team tasks and progress
use_cases.description: Manage project tasks with clear status indicators and handoff between team members using pm: and cc: markers.

use_cases.title: Organize development workflow
use_cases.description: Keep track of coding tasks, from TODO to WIP to completion, with automatic archiving of finished work.

use_cases.title: Manage client projects
use_cases.description: Maintain organized task lists for multiple projects with clear status tracking and completion dates.

prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new task to Plans.md: 'Implement user authentication' with details about email/password validation

prompt_templates.title: Mark task complete
prompt_templates.prompt: Mark the task 'Login form validation' as complete in Plans.md with today's date

prompt_templates.title: Update task status
prompt_templates.scenario: When starting work on a task
prompt_templates.prompt: Change the status of 'Database schema design' from cc:TODO to cc:WIP in Plans.md

prompt_templates.title: Archive old tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: Move all tasks completed more than 7 days ago to the archive section in Plans.md

output_examples.input: Add a task: Create API documentation

best_practices: Update task status immediately when starting or finishing work
Include relevant file paths in task descriptions for context
Use consistent marker format with backticks around status codes
anti_patterns: Don't leave tasks in WIP status when not actively working on them
Avoid creating tasks without proper status markers
Don't delete completed tasks - archive them instead

faq.question: Can I use this skill with files other than Plans.md?
faq.answer: No, this skill is specifically designed to work only with Plans.md files in the root directory.

faq.question: What are the supported status markers?

faq.question: How does task archiving work?
faq.answer: Tasks marked as complete are automatically moved to the archive section after 7 days to keep the active task list clean.

faq.question: Can I track subtasks?
faq.answer: Yes, you can create nested task lists under main tasks to track subtasks and their completion status.

faq.question: What happens if I make a mistake in the marker format?
faq.answer: The skill requires exact format with backticks. Mistakes like missing backticks or wrong spacing won't be recognized.

faq.question: Is this compatible with other project management tools?
faq.answer: This skill works with plain markdown files, making it tool-agnostic but requires manual integration with other systems.
